item.title: 2 dead in fiery small plane crash on Route 195 in Dartmouth
item.description: A small plane crashed on Route 195 in Dartmouth, Massachusetts Monday. Two people on board were killed.

item.title: 16 killed in Tennessee plant explosion remembered by community
item.description: The cause of the deadly blast remained under investigation. Crews were carefully going through incinerated property, searching for possible evidence.

item.title: Dozens rescued as remnants of typhoon hits Alaska while nor’easter brings flooding to East Coast
item.description: Authorities say more than 30 people were rescued and three people remain unaccounted for in western Alaska after the remnants of Typhoon Halong brough...

item.title: What to expect as Trump travels to Egypt for Gaza peace plan signing
item.description: President Trump is traveling to Egypt for a peace summit and to meet with world leaders before signing the Gaza peace plan. CBS News' Nancy Cordes has...

item.title: Arthur M. Blank Family Foundation donating $50 million to historically Black Atlanta colleges
WATCH: Israelis celebrate release of hostages
item.description: ABC News is in Tel Aviv's Hostage Square, as Israelis come together to celebrate the release of hostages held in Gaza.

item.title: Supreme Court takes up Republican attack on Voting Rights Act in case over Black representation
Trump touts 'historic dawn of a new Middle East' in Knesset speech
item.description: He bashed Presidents Obama and Biden, claiming they had "hatred toward Israel."

item.title: Elation for families of living hostages, while those of deceased decry delay
item.description: The families of the hostages released by Hamas are reacting following their release from captivity after being held for over two years.

item.title: Trump urges Israel and Palestinians to embrace peace as living hostages freed
item.description: President Trump got a standing ovation after addressing Israeli lawmakers following Hamas' release of all living hostages under the Gaza peace deal.

item.title: Uncertainty over economy, tariffs forces retailers to be cautious on holiday hiring
item.description: Rising tariff costs and other economic factors are forcing retailers to pull back or even delay their plans to hire seasonal workers
